column3: Quantification of outputs 55 of the budget execution circular for the financial year 2019/2020 states that the Accounting Officer is required to submit quarterly performance reports by the 30 th day of the first month of the next quarter. These reports should indicate the actual performance against the planned outputs and performance for each quarter, showing the quantity/quality and physical location of the reported outputs against expenditure. of the ten (10) outputs with a total of thirty-five (35) activities and expenditure of UGX.9.3 Bn sampled for assessment, I reviewed the extent of quantification of outputs and activities and noted the following; Five (5) outputs with a total of eighteen (18) activities and expenditure worth UGX.0.507 Bn were fully quantified. That is, all the eighteen (18) activities (100%) within these outputs were clearly quantified to enable assessment of performance.  Three (3) outputs with a total of fifteen (15) activities and expenditure worth UGX.8.84 Bn were insufficiently quantified. I observed that out of the fifteen (15) activities, eight (8) activities (53.3%) were quantified while seven (7) activities (46.7%) were not clearly quantified to enable assessment of performance.  Two (2) outputs with a total of two (2) activities were not quantified at all. That is, all the two (2) activities within these outputs were not clearly quantified to enable assessment of performance. to Table 7 below for a summary of extent of quantification and amounts spent.  Paragraph Out Refer
column10: I advised the Accounting Officer to ensure that there is sufficient quantification of all outputs and their activities to enable efficient monitoring and budget performance assessment. further advised the Accounting Officer to equip the Planning Unit with the necessary human resources to enable it undertake proper planning.
